nitf
Class TREDescription

java.lang.Object
  nitf.NITFObject
      nitf.DestructibleObject
          nitf.TREDescription

public final class TREDescription
extends DestructibleObject

Provides access to statically defined descriptions of TREs. It also allows users to create their own descriptions.

Field Summary
static int CONDITIONAL_LENGTH
          Specifies that the length of the TRE Description field should be computed by the library, and its length is based on a previous field value.
protected static java.util.Map userConstructed
          Map that keeps track of TREDescriptions that are NOT static

Field Detail

CONDITIONAL_LENGTH

public static final int CONDITIONAL_LENGTH
Specifies that the length of the TRE Description field should be computed by the library, and its length is based on a previous field value.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

userConstructed

protected static final java.util.Map userConstructed
Map that keeps track of TREDescriptions that are NOT static

Constructor Detail

TREDescription

public TREDescription(TREDescriptionDataType dataType,
                      int dataCount,
                      java.lang.String label,
                      java.lang.String tag)
               throws NITFException
Creates a new TREDescription

Parameters:
dataType - the type the data is Valid values: Field.NITF_BCS_A, Field.NITF_BCS_N, Field.BINARY, NITF_LOOP, NITF_ENDLOOP, NITF_IF, NITF_ENDIF, NITF_END
dataCount - the size of the data that this description represents
label - a legible descriptive label
tag - a unique tag representing the field
Throws:
NITFException

getEndMarker

public static TREDescription getEndMarker()
                                   throws NITFException
Returns the TREDescription used as the end marker for an array of TREDescriptions.

Users should always call this to get an end marker before ever setting an array of TREDescriptions to a TRE

Returns:
TREDescription end marker
Throws:
NITFException

getLoopMarker

public static TREDescription getLoopMarker(java.lang.String evaluator,
                                           java.lang.String loopTag)
                                    throws NITFException
Returns the TREDescription used as the marker for a LOOP

Parameters:
evaluator - this is the evaluation command: it is OPTIONAL Examples: "+ 1" --> add 1 to the value of the loopTag field's Field "* 4" --> multiply the value of the loopTag field's Field by 4
loopTag - the name of the tag whose value will be used as the loop count
Returns:
TREDescription end marker
Throws:
NITFException

Returns the TREDescription used as the marker for an ENDLOOP

Returns:
TREDescription marker

getIfMarker

public static TREDescription getIfMarker(java.lang.String evaluator,
                                         java.lang.String ifTag)
                                  throws NITFException
Returns the TREDescription used as the marker for an IF

Parameters:
evaluator - this is the evaluation command Examples: "eq GEOD" --> we want to see if it equals 'GEOD' "> 0" --> we want to see if the value is greater than zero
ifTag - the name of the tag whose value will be used in the control statement
Returns:
TREDescription marker
Throws:
NITFException
